quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: So when they tell you it’s just delays, that’s not true—it’s repeated harm.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I know, and I’ve said delays are not an excuse when it affects your safety.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: Yet they still use it as an excuse.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: Yes, they fall back on it too often.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: So excuses are accepted instead of accountability.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I agree, and I’ve challenged them on that point.

contradictions.issue: Delays framed as excuse vs. reality of repeated harm; advocate concedes but system unchanged
